segment.source: Network security Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network security Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, and values for the Network Security Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, and values for the Network Security Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities security policy setting.

segment.source: Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities
segment.target: Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, and values for the Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, and values for the Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Starting with Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7, the Negotiate Security Support Provider (SSP) supports an extension SSP, Negoexts.dll.
segment.target: Starting with Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7, the Negotiate Security Support Provider (SSP) supports an extension SSP, Negoexts.dll.

segment.source: This extension SSP is treated as an authentication protocol by the Windows operating system, and it supports SSPs from Microsoft, including PKU2U.
segment.target: This extension SSP is treated as an authentication protocol by the Windows operating system, and it supports SSPs from Microsoft, including PKU2U.

segment.source: You can also develop or add other SSPs.
segment.target: You can also develop or add other SSPs.

segment.source: When devices are configured to accept authentication requests by using online IDs, Negoexts.dll calls the PKU2U SSP on the computer that is used to log on.
segment.target: When devices are configured to accept authentication requests by using online IDs, Negoexts.dll calls the PKU2U SSP on the computer that is used to log on.

segment.source: The PKU2U SSP obtains a local certificate and exchanges the policy between the peer computers.
segment.target: The PKU2U SSP obtains a local certificate and exchanges the policy between the peer computers.

segment.source: When validated on the peer computer, the certificate within the metadata is sent to the logon peer for validation.
segment.target: When validated on the peer computer, the certificate within the metadata is sent to the logon peer for validation.

segment.source: It associates the user's certificate to a security token, and then the logon process completes.
segment.target: It associates the user's certificate to a security token, and then the logon process completes.

segment.source: Note: The ability to link online IDs can be performed by anyone with an account that has standard user’s credentials through Credential Manager.
segment.target: Note: The ability to link online IDs can be performed by anyone with an account that has standard user’s credentials through Credential Manager.

segment.source: This policy is not configured by default on domain-joined devices.
segment.target: This policy is not configured by default on domain-joined devices.

segment.source: This would disallow the online identities to be able to authenticate to the domain-joined computers in Windows 7 and later.
segment.target: This would disallow the online identities to be able to authenticate to the domain-joined computers in Windows 7 and later.

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: This will allow authentication to successfully complete between the two (or more) computers that have established a peer relationship through the use on online IDs.
segment.target: This will allow authentication to successfully complete between the two (or more) computers that have established a peer relationship through the use on online IDs.

segment.source: The PKU2U SSP obtains a local certificate and exchanges the policy between the peer devices.
segment.target: The PKU2U SSP obtains a local certificate and exchanges the policy between the peer devices.

segment.source: When validated on the peer computer, the certificate within the metadata is sent to the logon peer for validation.
segment.target: When validated on the peer computer, the certificate within the metadata is sent to the logon peer for validation.

segment.source: It associates the user's certificate to a security token, and then the logon process completes.
segment.target: It associates the user's certificate to a security token, and then the logon process completes.

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: This will prevent online IDs from being used to authenticate the user to another computer in a peer-to-peer relationship.
segment.target: This will prevent online IDs from being used to authenticate the user to another computer in a peer-to-peer relationship.

segment.source: Not set.
segment.target: Not set.

segment.source: Not configuring this policy prevents online IDs from being used to authenticate the user.
segment.target: Not configuring this policy prevents online IDs from being used to authenticate the user.

segment.source: This is the default on domain-joined devices
segment.target: This is the default on domain-joined devices

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: Within a domain, domain accounts should be used for authentication.
segment.target: Within a domain, domain accounts should be used for authentication.

segment.source: Set this policy to Disabled or do not configure this policy to exclude online identities from being used to authenticate.
segment.target: Set this policy to Disabled or do not configure this policy to exclude online identities from being used to authenticate.

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.target: Domain controller effective default settings

segment.target: Disabled

segment.target: Member server effective default settings

segment.target: Disabled

segment.target: Effective GPO default settings on client computers

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting allows a user’s account on one computer to be associated with an online identity, such as Microsoft Account, so that account can log on to a peer device (if the peer device is likewise configured) without the use of a Windows logon account (domain or local).
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting allows a user’s account on one computer to be associated with an online identity, such as Microsoft Account, so that account can log on to a peer device (if the peer device is likewise configured) without the use of a Windows logon account (domain or local).

segment.source: Although this is beneficial for workgroups or home groups, using this feature in a domain-joined environment might circumvent your established security policies.
segment.target: Although this is beneficial for workgroups or home groups, using this feature in a domain-joined environment might circumvent your established security policies.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Set this policy to Disabled or do not configure this security policy for domain-joined devices.
segment.target: Set this policy to Disabled or do not configure this security policy for domain-joined devices.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: If you do not set or disable this policy, the PKU2U protocol will not be used to authenticate between peer devices, which forces users to follow domain defined access control policies.
segment.target: If you do not set or disable this policy, the PKU2U protocol will not be used to authenticate between peer devices, which forces users to follow domain defined access control policies.

segment.source: If you enable this policy, you will allow your users to authenticate by using local certificates between systems that are not part of a domain that uses PKU2U.
segment.target: If you enable this policy, you will allow your users to authenticate by using local certificates between systems that are not part of a domain that uses PKU2U.

segment.source: This will allow users to share resources between devices
segment.target: This will allow users to share resources between devices
